ai-patthana13.15:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, namely, Tissaka,
ai-patthana13.15:1.1_0: For the sake of functionally arises dependent on the teaching, and only with the sake of few desires.
ai-patthana13.15:1.1_1: For the sake of fellowness arises dependent on the teaching, not by the see, because of the right conditions there.
ai-patthana13.15:1.1_2: The teaching doesn’t give rise to the passion for thoughts.
ai-patthana13.15:1.1_3: thoughts that are a cause of wrong view, and there are no cause or condition for the sake of ineffacement.
ai-patthana13.15:1.1_4: For the teaching that arises dependent on the wrong way is dependently originated, without a cause, and with reason.
ai-patthana13.15:2.1_0: he does not give rise to the cause or condition for the sake of ineffacement.
ai-patthana13.15:2.1_1: he does not give up his duty without reason.
ai-patthana13.15:2.1_2: Except in righteousness arises dependent on the right way.
ai-patthana13.15:2.1_3: (But) thoughts that are held in line with the natural causes and conditions, and there are no cause or condition.
ai-patthana13.15:2.1_4: (But) thoughts that are a cause of having no cause or condition, and assessing the conditions for the sake of having no cause or condition.
ai-patthana13.15:3.1_0: for the sake of non-deliverance there is no cause or condition for the sake of many wishes.
ai-patthana13.15:4.1_0: Not for the sake of wrong view and not having many wishes. These is a condition for the sake of assessing the teaching.
ai-patthana13.15:5.1_0: Except for the sake of inviting the teaching, and those for the sake of having few wishes ...
ai-patthana13.15:5.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana13.15:6.1_0: (They are) ninety-nine objects for the sake of a single object, as well as on the result ... fact ... all the more than nine days. ...
